title: Replace deprecated `isEqualToComparingFieldByField` assert
body:
### Description

The AssertJ [`isEqualToComparingFieldByField`](https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.assertj/assertj-core/3.18.1/org/assertj/core/api/AbstractObjectAssert.html#isEqualToComparingFieldByField(java.lang.Object)) assertion is deprecated and should be replaced with the [`usingRecursiveComparison().isEqualTo`](https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.assertj/assertj-core/3.18.1/org/assertj/core/api/AbstractObjectAssert.html#usingRecursiveComparison()) assertion. As the name implies, this new method will recursively compare all of the fields in the object instead of only first level of fields. It's not surprising that this breaks some tests but I'm not sure of the proper fixes for these. Fields can be ignored with the [`ignoringFields`](https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.assertj/assertj-core/3.18.1/org/assertj/core/api/RecursiveComparisonAssert.html#ignoringFields(java.lang.String...)) method but I'm not sure which fields, if any, should be ignored. It's possible that these tests were not properly checking everything.

If you replace all instances of `isEqualToComparingFieldByField` with `usingRecursiveComparison().isEqualTo` the following tests will fail. I have collected their output below.

<details closed>
<summary>V1LevelDbDatabaseTest > shouldRecordAndRetrieveGenesisInformation</summary>

```

    java.lang.AssertionError:

    to be equal to:
      MinGenesisTimeBlockEvent{timestamp=4666673844721362956, blockNumber=4665021361504678828, blockHash=0xfd18cf40cc907a739be483f1ca0ee23ad65cdd3df23205eabc6d660a75d1f54e}
    when recursively comparing field by field, but found the following 2 differences:

    field/property 'blockHash.bytes' differ:
    - actual value  : [12, 40, 57, -3, 34, 91, -61, 64, -84, 115, 24, 66, 54, 124, -67, 64, -3, 24, -49, 64, -52, -112, 122, 115, -101, -28, -125, -15, -54, 14, -30, 58, -42, 92, -35, 61, -14, 50, 5, -22, -68, 109, 102, 10, 117, -47, -11, 78]
    - expected value: [-3, 24, -49, 64, -52, -112, 122, 115, -101, -28, -125, -15, -54, 14, -30, 58, -42, 92, -35, 61, -14, 50, 5, -22, -68, 109, 102, 10, 117, -47, -11, 78]
    actual and expected values are arrays of different size, actual size=48 when expected size=32

    field/property 'blockHash.offset' differ:
    - actual value  : 16
    - expected value: 0
```
